06/03/2020

Events are being held all week to promote equality

Image by YUSU WNBN

By Emily Hewat


INTERNATIONAL Womenâ€™s Week has come to York; Monday 2nd through to Sunday 8th MarchÂ  events will be held all over campus to celebrate womenâ€™s achievements,highlight barriers that women still face and inspire action for achieving equality. The message for International Womenâ€™s Day 2020 (8 March) is that collectively, each one of us can help create a gender equal world.

YUSUâ€™s Women and Non-binary network (WNBN) coordinates campaigns all year round for students.Recently in the run up to International Womenâ€™s Week they have been shining a light on abusive relationships; the Red Flag campaign lead by Grace Clark works to highlight behaviours that often hallmark toxic relationships among university students. Details of the Red Flag campaign can be found on Instagram (@officalredflagcampaign).
